page.title: 07BROOK BANK FARM
page.content: (Continued) The best sort of breed are Friesians. Dad keeps 4 horses and 40 beef stock. There is about 70 head of stock sold for slaughtering each year. The most common diseases on the farm are mastitas and e-coli. The best sort of food for cows is grass. The milk is taken to a Milk Marketing Board depot. Since the milk quota came in, Dad can not make more money than the quota allows. An average buying price for a milking cow is Â£550. It takes 3 hours per day to milk. There are other jobs on the farm like cleaning yards and the parlour, land cultivation and fertilising. The future for dairy farmers is very uncertain. Dad enjoys being a farmer but only when things are going well (Which is very uncertain). Clive
